page.title: 18R.A.F.
page.content: Construction of{R.A.F. Coningsby}was begun in {1937}and finished in {1940 flying Hampden bombers and finally Lancasters during World WarII.There are about 2000 people working on the camp,about{1750}in uniform of whom {140}are{W.R.A.F.}They have {40 planes including the{Battle of Britain {Memorial Flight.} There is one squadron on camp which is {29 fighter squadron}and an {O.C.U. which forms{54 Reserve Squadron}in wartime. R.A.F.Coningsby is part of strike command and is financed from the air defence budget.There are{7}hangars and{22}hardened aircraft shelters.The current{Phantom}jets,used as interceptors,are being replaced by the swing-wing{Tornados.} On camp they have{2 master computers and lots of terminals.
